title: Mexican mayor deploys life-sized cardboard cutout of himself for official events he can't attend
text:
A mayor of a town in southern Mexico has been criticized for deploying a life-sized cardboard cutout of himself at an official event he was unable to attend.

Constituents in the city of Pichuclaco, Chiapas, were outraged when Moisés Aguilar Torres sent a cardboard image of himself to an outing last Friday for health services.

The cutout shows a casually dressed mayor raising the right fist in the air.

A cardboard cutout of Moisés Aguilar Torres (pictured ninth from left to right in the second row), mayor of Pichuclaco, Chiapas, was displayed at an event on Friday as a photo prop for constituents who participated in a health services event

The mayor of Pichuclaco, a city in the southern Mexican state of Chiapas, has turned to the installing of a large-sized cardboard cutout (third from left to right) of his likeness at events that he is physically unavailable to attend

Those that expected to meet the former nurse turned politician instead had to settle for a photo opportunity with the human-sized cutout.

Residents took to social media to express their anger at Aguilar Torres' - especially as it was an official function at which more than 200 people, including children and the elderly, received medical treatment.

Mayoral aide Jose Alejandro Bustamante Maza tried to damped the criticism by noting the success of the event.

'This is how our mayor makes decisions for the benefit of citizens in the health sector because serving is his commitment,' Bustamante Maza said.

A bevy of images on the city's Facebook account highlight the mayor posing for photographs with citizens at sporting and community events since becoming mayor in 2018.

Despite the uproar, the administration is yet to decide if the cutout will be retired or if it will be wheeled out again for further official duties.
description: Moisés Aguilar Torres is being criticized over his decision to introduce a cardboard cutout of himself at official events he is unable to physically attend.
